text:
Ms. [**Known lastname 861**] is a 81 year old woman admitted to T/SICU from the OR
   following a subtotal colectomy with an end ileostomy for bowel
   ischemia.
   *admitted to [**Hospital1 19**] [**8-5**] for NSTEMI Mi, cath
d and angioplasty done of
   RCA (had R groin hematoma post procedure)
   *on [**8-12**] had rapid afib (rate to 150
s), converted to sinus with
   digoxin and then 30 minutes after confusion began complaining of
   abdominal pain.  CT of abdomen done and was concerning for ischemic
   bowel.  To OR for resection.
   Postop:
   Initially stable then developed rapid afib to 180 with hypotension
   [**8-13**], failed electrical cardioversion, cardioverted with amio.
   In and out of afib. [**Last Name (un) 3864**] placed, bedside echo done.
   Atrial fibrillation (Afib)
   Assessment:
   At start of shift was in SR with HR 60
s. SBP 110-120
s. MAP >60 Amio
   drip infusing @ 0.5mg/min.
   Action:
   Amio gtt continues. Started milrinone bolus and patient became more
   hypotensive, so that was held. Diltiazem drip started with attempt to
   rate control and titrated between 5-15 mg/hr. metoprolol 5 mg IV given
   x1.
   Response:
   Afib with RVR best rate controlled after 5mg IV lopressor, and
   diltiazem now titrated down to 5mg/hr. patient converted to SR
   mid-morning and now with HR in the 60s. Levo weaned off and neo
   titrated up to maintain MAP 60
   Plan:
   PTT pending for heparin titration.  continue NEO  to support BP as
   needed and continue dilt drip at 5 mg/hr, with metoprolol PRN for
   increased HR.
   Pain control (acute pain, chronic pain)
   Assessment:
   Fentanyl drip titrated to maintain pain control.
   Action:
   Titrated down for vetn wean. Fentanyl boluses of 25mcg before turns.
   Response:
   Continues to grimace with turns but rests quietly when undisturbed.
   Tolerating wean well.
   Plan:
   Continue fentanyl for pain with increased dose for turning and
   procedures.
   Myocardial infarction, acute (AMI, STEMI, NSTEMI)
   Assessment:
   Afib as above.  Cool extremities. CO adequate [**First Name8 (NamePattern2) **] [**Last Name (un) 3864**]. SV down to
   40cc while she is in afib. Increase in cr from 0.6 yesterday to 1.8
   today. Adequate urine output. Weight up to 60kg (preop 50kg).  Hands
   and feet edematous. Remains vented.
   Action:
   Mouth care per vap protocol. Q 1hour hemodynamics. Levophed changed to
   neo to support bp with less beta agonist effect. Family updated with
   plan and condition. TTE preformed today.  Diltiazem drip on for HR
   control.
   Response:
   Continues to be pressor dependent. Continues to have activity
   intolerance, improved since last night. Generalized edema noted and cr
   increased indicating poor perfusion though urine output adequate.
   Awaiting formal read of TTE
    Plan:
   Continue to maximize CO/CI with use of pressors/IVF boluses PRN.  Wean
   pressors if indicated and continue to closely [**Initials (NamePattern4) **] [**Last Name (NamePattern4) **] [**Last Name (un) 3864**] numbers.
   Intestinal ischemia (including mesenteric venous / arterial thrombosis,
   bowel ischemia)
   Assessment:
   Midline incision with R sided end ileostomy. Remains npo. Ileostomy
   pink with small amount of golden stool..  Afebrile, wbc flat.
   Continues to have tenderness and guarding in belly on exam.  Ng with
   minimal output
   Action:
   Antibiotics dc
d today. Abdominal exam remains unremarkable. Stoma
   nurse consulted and will see patient tomorrow.
   Response:
   Probable incisional pain in abdomen.  Hypoactive bowel sounds. Small
   amount of ileostomy output. Stoma appears healthy
   Plan:
   Cont to follow fever curve and return of bowel function.  ??nutrition
   whether she will soon tolerate enteral feedings or need tpn. Stoma
   nurse to see patient tomorrow.
